atDirectives.name: @theme
atDirectives.description: Tailwind CSS @theme directive to define your project's custom design tokens, like fonts, colors, and breakpoints.

atDirectives.name: @source
atDirectives.description: Tailwind CSS @utility directive to explicitly specify source files that aren't picked up by Tailwind's automatic content detection.

atDirectives.name: @utility
atDirectives.description: Tailwind CSS @utility directive to add custom utilities to your project that work with variants like hover, focus and lg.

atDirectives.name: @variant
atDirectives.description: Tailwind CSS @variant directive to apply a Tailwind variant to styles in your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @custom-variant
atDirectives.description: Tailwind CSS @custom-variant directive to add a custom variant in your project.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Tailwind CSS @apply directive to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS.

atDirectives.name: @reference
atDirectives.description: Tailwind CSS @reference directive. If you want to use @apply or @variant in the <style> block of a Vue or Svelte component, or within CSS modules, you will need to import your theme configuration to make those values available in that context.
